content.raw:
I fixed two of the test worlds in 8462f44, so the physics test will now exit (it was hanging for two different reasons). It has two failing tests:
~~~
[  FAILED  ] PhysicsEngines/PhysicsTest.RevoluteJoint/2, where GetParam() = "simbody"
[  FAILED  ] PhysicsEngines/PhysicsTest.DropStuff/2, where GetParam() = "simbody"
~~~
@hsu Can you take a peek at those and see if they aren't parameter related? If not, then we can create issues and comment out portions.

content.raw: I've adjusted some of the default simbody parameters in [sdformat a912ec9](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/commits/a912ec9b3a1b9333ab7aa116ef7414df6d45ff9c) (pull request forthcoming). Along with 0918b95 in branch simbody_scpeters, the SpawnDrop tests are now passing.

content.raw:
INTEGRATION_physics_msgs fails because simbody doesn't yet support shape resizing
~~~
[  FAILED  ] PhysicsEngines/PhysicsMsgsTest.SimpleShapeResize/2, where GetParam() = "simbody" 
~~~
I've created issue #856 for this and provided a workaround for the test in branch simbody_scpeters (5a0ecd4).

content.raw:
Are we sacrificing ODE testing in favor of Simbody and DART? Seems like we should keep `joint->Detach` and conditionally freeze the joint for engines that can't detach.

Ideally we should test both joint detach and joint freeze for all physic engines.
content.html:
Are we sacrificing ODE testing in favor of Simbody and DART? Seems like we should keep joint->Detach and conditionally freeze the joint for engines that can't detach.

Ideally we should test both joint detach and joint freeze for all physic engines.

content.raw:
From our debian repo:
~~~
sudo apt-get install libsimbody-dev
~~~


Or if yo want to compile from source,
~~~
git clone git@github.com:simbody/simbody.git -b simbody-3.3
~~~

I use following cmake options:
~~~
mkdir build
cd build
cmake -DCMAKE_MODULE_PATH=${HOME}/local/share/cmake -DSimTK_INSTALL_PREFIX=${HOME}/local -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Release' ..
~~~
content.html:
From our debian repo:

sudo apt-get install libsimbody-dev

Or if yo want to compile from source,

git clone git@github.com:simbody/simbody.git -b simbody-3.3

I use following cmake options:

mkdir build
cd build
cmake -DCMAKE_MODULE_PATH=${HOME}/local/share/cmake -DSimTK_INSTALL_PREFIX=${HOME}/local -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Release' ..

content.raw: Remember that you can use apt-get install in the usual way to get all the simbody stuff.
content.html: Remember that you can use apt-get install in the usual way to get all the simbody stuff.

content.raw: I tried to make it as transparent as possible when installing debs, so in the debs generation process [I move the upstream finder to a default cmake location](https://github.com/j-rivero/simbody/blob/43c46b9fd0e79f3249a0e3d564bc782ec92870d0/debian/rules).
content.html: I tried to make it as transparent as possible when installing debs, so in the debs generation process I move the upstream finder to a default cmake location.
